text: I should have thought youcould have got it for yourself.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: I'm going to bed now.I've taken a sleeping pill.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: I'm going to Sheffieldin the morning.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Sheffield?To stay with Jessy and Bob.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: You can't just leave me here.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text:
I can't stand Jessy,you know that.
She talks too much.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: What am I meantto do then?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text:
Not a soul set footin this house
for two years, nearly.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Not since the Evanses.We've no money.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: You haven't workedsince I don't know when.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text:
Not with my backand everything. The doctor
says I should be in hospital.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: What's that supposed to mean?You know what I mean.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: I get these terrible headaches.Very unpleasant, oh, very unpleasant.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: medically speaking, of course,it's a very interesting condition,
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: uh, syndrome, as we call it.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: You're not a doctor, are you?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Well, now how did you know that?Well, I should say, I was.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text:
I did a favour for a friend.A lady friend. I expect you
understand. You know how it is.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Oh, yes. Oh, dear.Can I get you another cup of tea?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text:
Yes, well, of course.They won't do you
any good, mind.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: What does, though?Well, if only I was free to, uh...
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: You certainly do yourselfproud in here, I must say.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: My wife's away.I don't blame her.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text:
You can keep that mattress,for a start. I'd have the
whole shop running alive.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: What, for everything?Everything, bar that mattress.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: That'll walk out by itself.Ten pounds?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Well, surely it must be worth 15.Not to me, it isn't.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: I can't work. I was wounded in the war.That's tough luck, squire.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Twelve is my top.Yes or no?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: All right.I'll have the van round this afternoon.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: I was just lookingthrough my papers.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: I was in all the papersa few years back.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Of course, I wasin the police once, so I...
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: In all the papersa few years back, and now...
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Well, of course, if that'sthe way you're going to talk...
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: It's what I'd expect, of course.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Really smells bad in here.We'll soon get it cleaned up.
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: What are you doing?Looking for work?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: Have you got anything on youto prove your identity?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: No, nothing at all.Take your hat off, will you?
title: 10 Rillington Place

text: I shall have to take youinto custody. Come along.
